result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald G Merritt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  
Sentence credit of 10 days was granted, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid JOINT AND SEVERAL with co-actor and to be paid before costs or fines for:
E.H. in the amount of $624.00
American Family Insurance in the amout of $1,148.33
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with: Victim (E.H.), her residence or family; or any co-actors listed in the criminal complaint.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Donald G Merritt in court, in custody (OTP'd from Jefferson County Jail), with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  5 Years.
Initial Confinement:   2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2.5 Years.
10 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  3.5 Years. 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (E.H.) her residence or family; or any co-actors listed in  the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

RESTITUTION:  $1,772.33 joint/several with co-actors (Breakdown:  $624 to be paid to victim (E.H.) and $1,148.33 to be paid to American Family Insurance - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Court specifically denies the defense request for expungement.


Defendant to be returned to Jefferson County Jail - FORTHWITH.

Court clerk received phone call from Atty Tishberg advising the court that he is trial in Milwaukee County and can't make the Plea/sentencing at 3pm today. 
Defendant to remain in the Waukesha County Jail until sentencing on Friday (time undetermined at this momemt).
filed, to be produced from Jefferson County Jail
